primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition from a life of anxiety and 'phony desires' to a life of trust and communion with God through the refocusing of the human will.

tekstueel_bewijs: Lent asks us to wait and to watch and to notice
I will not entertain all those other lusts
Lent is a time to quit running

object.identificatie: A 'reorganized, refocused, reoriented life' of trust
tekstueel_bewijs: the true joy and purpose of life are to love God and be loved by God
to be freed of all the others that turn out to be idolatrous

zender.identificatie: The Lenten Season / The Preacher (as a source of mandate)
tekstueel_bewijs: Lent is a time to quit running
I invite you in this Lent to see differently

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer (as the beneficiary of their own refocusing)
tekstueel_bewijs: You will... be free and joyous and generous
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The hearer is the one who must 'do' the refocusing)

helper.identificatie: God (as a provider of resources and a 'pursuer')
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me
God sets a table of generous food
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (God provides the 'pasture' so the Subject can 'trust')
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent (The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of power)

tekstueel_bewijs: our busyness, our drive and energy and control
the greed and lust and satiation and aggressive ambition of a consumer society
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a set of bad habits or social pressures that the subject must 'decide' against.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Shepherd (God) caring for the Sheep.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God (Yahweh)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The safety and sustenance of the sheep
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon correctly identifies that in the Psalm, God is the subject ('The sheep has no verbs'), but then immediately frames this as a 'Lenten project' where the hearer must become the subject to achieve that state.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: God's Mercy → The Hearer ← Consumer Society

voorbeelden_god_subject: He has led us into green pastures.
God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I invite you... to see past your anxiety.

voorbeelden: we always must want one more thing
I will not entertain all those other lusts
It is a mark of discernment and maturity
Lent is about noticing our blindness
You will... be free (as a result of seeing)

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on motivating the human will (Vouloir) to choose trust, assuming that if the hearer 'sees' correctly (Savoir), they will 'do' (Performance).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Anxiety) to ~S2 (Refocusing) to S1 (Trust).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human 'discernment' and 'decision' rather than a divine act of rescue.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is seen as 'petty loyalties' and 'phony desires' rather than a terminal condition like Death or Sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high-quality exegetical insights about God's activity in Psalm 23, it frames the application as a human 'Lenten project.' It oscillates between God as the actor in the text and the Human as the actor in the life of the hearer.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You will, when you see truly, be free and joyous.
I will refocus my desire... This Lord will be Lord of our wants (as a result of our refocusing).

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me and chase me down.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sheep is used as a model for how the hearer should 'learn to trust.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on the Shepherd's inability to lose a sheep, rather than the sheep's 'decision' to trust.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology becomes a matter of correct perception and alignment of the will.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: There is a clash between the 'Sheep has no verbs' section and the 'Lenten project' section.
spanning_punten: The sermon claims the sheep does nothing, then tells the hearer they must 'refocus' and 'decide' to be like the sheep.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Lent is about noticing our blindness, and seeing differently.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer has the inherent power to 'refocus' if they are simply told to.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'distraction' or 'anxiety' rather than a power that binds the will.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (through 'coming down where you ought to be')

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon has a strong 'God-Subject' in its exegesis but a 'Man-Subject' in its application.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'refocusing' and 'noticing.'
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject of the 'opening of eyes' and 'reorienting of hearts.'
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'I will refocus my desire,' use 'The Good Shepherd captures our wandering desires and tethers them to His goodness.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'dumb sheep' metaphor more—sheep don't refocus themselves; they are carried.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase POUVOIR (God's power to change us).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God's 'pursuing mercy' actually breaks our resistance.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present anxiety as a 'shadow of death' that we cannot escape on our own.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the 'Helper' (God) becomes optional or merely instrumental.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God chases us) → Ethics (We find ourselves refocused).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon contains beautiful imagery and deep respect for the text, but it risks burdening the hearer with a 'Lenten project' that only God can accomplish.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is inviting and poetic; actantially, it is a recruitment of the human will.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: The exegesis of Psalm 23 is theocentric, but the homiletical move to the hearer's life is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals the 'Subject-Switch' where the preacher says God does everything (in the Bible) but then asks the hearer to do everything (in Lent).

appendices.notnotes: The sermon is a classic example of 'Exegetical Grace/Homiletical Law'.
